text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-President Hrawi said: The people want municipal and mayoral elections and parliamentry deputies should keep their promises.
-Prime Minister Hariri on an official trip to Canada after Moscow.
-Arab parliamentary delegations at Seoul conference condemned the Qana massacre in which Israel killed about 100 Lebanese citizens in a south Lebanon U.N. peacekeepers' camp last year.
-Maronite patriarchs: Political life is absent and the judiciary is losing its independence.
-Lebanon asks U.S. authorities to arrest Lebanese businessman Roger Tamraz.
-A bomb blast in south Lebanon wounds four South Lebanon Army militiamen.
-Papal nuncio Puente announced the Pope's official program during the May 10-11 visit to Beirut.
-Lebanon and Qatar sign a cooperation agreement in the field of agriculture.
